item.title: The Four Pillars of Object Oriented Programming
item.description: Abstraction Only making certain aspects of the program accessible from outside of the class (private methods). Encapsulation Wrapping up the methods and attributes of the class within the class itself. Inheritance A class’ ability to inherit attributes and methods from other classes (keeps your code DRY). Polymorphism Classes that inherit from each other being able to invoke the same method and receive a different result.
